timeline.bodyText:
This method throws an error while setting up the bitbucket project (line 132/133): org.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException$Unauthorized: 401
What might I do wrong here? Is there an easier way to upload/create a template file, to test the GET request?
timeline.author: clemenszuck

replies.bodyText: I entered my credentials for bitbucket etc. in the application-artemis.yml using my personal account, are there any special rights needed to setup these repositories?
replies.author: clemenszuck

replies.bodyText: Yes, you need special permissions for those actions. I guess we want to mock bitbucket @krusche?
replies.author: jpbernius
clemenszuck

replies.bodyText:
It depends what you want to achieve here. If you simply need a programming exercise in the database, just add it directly using the corresponding repository.
If you need git repositories, you can also create them in the temp folder of the system and tell the git service (using mockito) to use them instead of the real ones.
You might also want to use these methods to mock bitbucket, but it really depends what you want to achieve here
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText:
The main thing I want to achieve is to create a file in the folder
files/templates
Unfortunately it is not possible to move files there manually using the fileService and the only way (I found) to create a file there is via the setupProgrammingExercise method.
But it is not clear for me how to mock that method or whats the cleanest way to create such a file.
replies.author: clemenszuck

replies.bodyText: then I suggest to leave this out for now. It does not make sense to call setupProgrammingExercise just to create files in the templates folder!
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: Ok I disabled the test case and added a TODO.
replies.author: clemenszuck

timeline.bodyText: This GET request failes, because the attachment file cannot be found. I created and uploaded the file and moved it to the correct folder. What might I be missing here?
timeline.author: clemenszuck

replies.bodyText: The error 404 is thrown when the file should be returned, but it can not be found at the given path attachmentPath, allthough I saved it there just before.
replies.author: clemenszuck

replies.bodyText: I committed the change that fixes this issue. You didn't put the lecture in the id folder, so it couldn't find it
replies.author: maxr96

timeline.message: Disabled test to get template file
improve tests and fix wrong error message during lecture attachment file upload with wrong file type
